Strawberry Eton Mess Recipe | Bon Appétit

The meringues will soften as they sit, giving just the right amount of texture.Ingredients4 servings1lb. strawberries, hulled, sliced into thirds, plus whole berries for serving⅓cup sugar1½cups heavy cream2.5 oz. store-bought meringuesPreparationStep 1Toss half of sliced berries with sugar in a medium heatproof bowl. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and set over a medium saucepan filled with 1" of barely simmering water. Let sit until berries are soft and juices have accumulated in bowl, 25–30 minutes. Let cool, then toss in remaining sliced berries.Step 2Whisk cream in a medium bowl to soft peaks. Layer cream, meringues, then strawberry mixture in four 8-oz. glasses. Chill 20 minutes. Top with whole strawberries to serve.How would you rate Strawberry Eton Mess?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleMade this to take to a friends for dinner, it was a big hit!  Light and fresh.
